body.name: UMIDIGI Cell Phone G1, Android12 Unlocked Cell Phone, Dual Sim 4G LTE Mobile Phone, 3+32GB 256G Expandable, 6.52" HD+, 5150mAh, GSM Unlocked
body.stockDetail: Only 2 left in stock - order soon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 13. Order within 16 hrs 32 mins
Or fastest pickup Tomorrow, February 12. Order within 16 hrs 2 mins
features: UNLOCKED CELL PHONES: GSM unlocked international version. Dual 4G LTE. Compatible in the US with most GSM carriers like T-Mobile, AT&T, etc. If the connection got a problem, just contact us, we would solve the problem with the new IMEI no. within 24hrs WILL NOT work with CDMA carriers such as Verizon, Sprint, Boost, etc. DON’T work with Straight Talk, MetroPCS.

LONG LASTING BATTERY& BIG SCREEN: The unlocked android phones feature a long-lasting battery that helps you power through a day with a 5150mAh battery. With 10w power fast charging, you don't need to waste too much time on battery. This unlocked cell phones 4G gots a 6.52” HD full large screen with vivid color and wide viewing angles. It offers you a cinema-like immersive visual experience no matter when you are watching movies or playing games.

STABLE PERFORMANCE: with Android 12 + MediaTek MT6739 fast processor+ expandable memory up to 256G , UMIDIGI G1 provides advanced performance, fast processor without lags, and smooth for apps, videos, and games.

TRENDY DESIGN, SHINING, AND LIGHTWEIGHT： With shining AG matte design, UMIDIGI G1 all have stunning appearance and color, which can also prevent fingerprints so that the device can retain its pristine look at all times. It is only 195g and is lightweight. Easy to operate.

CONVENIENT FACE UNLOCK& CAMERA: UMIDIGI smartphones G1 with a dual camera brings more details to your creativity. 13MP main camera,5MP selfie camera, 2MP macro camera, capture your favorite moments in vivid color to mark every glorious moment. Get your phone unlocked upon recognizing your face with AI face unlock, which is safe and quick.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good phone for a good price
reviews.reviewText: Android 12 GO is a little weird, and sometimes a little slow, but the screen is quite large and the camera is quite clear. I'm a big fan of the Galaxy Blue colour too!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Phone is so slow and cuts out phone calls. Waste of money DO NOT Buy!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good for what you pay (~$80 when I bought it).
reviews.reviewText: Bottom line is, if you need a phone that works (and not much more), this is a great value. It's got some small annoyances, but it beats out paying 4-6 times as much if you don't need anything fancy.Runs Netflix, YouTube, and Maps mostly without issue. Camera is decent if you give it a few seconds to adjust. Came with a screen protector pre-installed. Positive(?) slogan on the backside for comedic effect brightens your day.Hardware is definitely underpowered- there's a bit of stuttering and lag with apps, so you'll need to be patient, and forget playing any kind of 3D game or application. Unusual audio/video stuttering during streaming can be an annoyance, but pausing for a second or two usually resolves it. Screen protector works, but is cheap and bubbles up a little where you get a scratch or ding on it; definitely recommend replacing with a higher-quality protector if you're rough with your phone. Speaker isn't quite as loud as other phones I've had, but it's usually loud enough. Battery life is enough to get you through a couple days, even with a few hours of streaming video, but it's risky not to charge it every night.Small annoyances with the OS: Dark Mode doesn't apply to some apps. Location is usually kept off, but the icon keeps popping up on the notification bar, which is worrisome. The interface has way more padding than it should regardless of font size chosen, making the whole interface seem crowded or zoomed-in. Alarms kept getting silenced because the Clock app kept getting its battery usage restricted no matter what permissions or settings were applied- finally stopped after messing with some things, but not sure what did it. Can't mute notifications for, or disable, proprietary hardware management app DuraSpeed. Can't get rid of or move the Google Search bar, though I think that one's Android's fault.What's not Android's fault though is the watermark on the camera which has to be manually turned off.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars GREAT BATTERY LIFE AND GOOD PERMORMANCE FOR A BUDGET PHONE
reviews.reviewText: OK,lets be honest,this is a 100 bucks phone,so you should not expect a performance of a flagship phone,so that said,i can tell you that if you are looking for a phone to do basic things and a little bit more,this is a goodphone.phone is unlocked ,i cant tell you if will work with your carrier,but i can assure you this phone will work with tmobile and any prepaid service under tmobile network,i used in this case a simple mobile service which i have good coverage in my area,so everything worked like a champ.camera is decent again this is a budget friendly phone. i will update if i feel the need to do it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I gave this phone to my mother in-law. It takes time to connect to wifi. Most of the time when I video call her on the facebook messenger her camera doesn’t show right away which means the phone is slow even when the internet is fast. The volume is the worst. I got her earphones and still low. The battery life is good. I can’t return it because I got shipped to the Philippines.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I am not a phone tech or anything so I don't know the fancy way to describe my problems, but I've only had this phone for two days and ever since I first turned it on it's been incredibly slow at processing anything. If you have thin patience, definitely do not buy this phone lol.It takes a second for it to register me tapping the screen and also took a million years to download any apps when I first started up the phone. (Again, I've only had this phone for two days.) You also can not watch videos without restarting them because the FPS is always super glitchy until you restart it. The phone also gets overwhelmed (?) and sometimes closes out of apps randomly, even if it's the only app I have open. And it's not my wifi/data because both worked perfectly fine on my other phone.Battery life is also not amazing. I've only been on it for two hours and it's dropped 30%. However, it did come with a Type-C cord which is nice because I know some companies aren't doing that anymore lol. So if you want to pay $100 for a type-c charger and a crappy phone then this product is perfect for you. <3

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to setup and use
reviews.reviewText: Took only minutes to setup and use. The Unidigi G1 is a good value for the price. Screen size is nice, and it's light weight. I'm able to manage with no problem with all apps. Would recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars It does not work with any provider as advertised. They are not refunding me or letting me return it.
reviews.reviewText: It doesn't work right and has never worked right. Had it checked and set up by all the right people. Now it is totally dead and there is No reason why. Total waste of money. I bought it just over a month ago and now I found out it does not work with my provider. It was advertised to work with any.We were discussing returning it and I needed a label. You offered to send me a watch instead but I don't want the watch. Please send me a label or please refund me.

reviews.reviewTitle: The mini manual just contained a few basic things .
reviews.reviewText: After a more thorough review of capabilities (involving dedicating some time to learn how to use it properly), I am now giving this smartphone a 5-star rating. The preliminary complaints were due to my unfamiliarity with a more sophisticated phone compared to my last Android 7 dinosaur.See my revised and additional comments at the bottom of this review. The existing positive comments till apply.There is no manual online for this model. However, there is a general G1 setup manual online. The display keeps dimming and going black within seconds. Then I have to go through the unlock process again. I have set it to stay on for 30 minutes, but it still keeps dimming and going black.After 3 weeks, I am still trying to sort out how to operate this model.I am using a pin on setup instructions. There is a face print reader, but have not found it yet.My above previous review was heavily redacted, admittedly written with some extraneous material.I must confess to wanting an Umidigi to work. Internet reviews range from zero to very good technologically. Owner Johnny Zhang has accomplished miracles in tech advances in his 15 years since its startup. Umidigi is one of the top 10 such companies in China. The phones are attractive, feel good to hold, colours are great, cameras are pretty good. I have been dealing back and forth with a support person since day 3. The English email responses can be confusing. A major concern is the CPU overheating (if it burns out, then I just have a paperweight left. I have constant CPU overheating on startup and have to run the cooler, and if left on for an hour, the same overheating notice appears and I run the cooler each time. I set up a separate monitor which indicates the actual temperature on the main menu.I do not have a phone service provider, but find it works O.K. with a sim and TF/SD card.I was kindly offered a new G1 model to test and keep if I would fill out a satisfactory survey. The model turned out to be an Android 11 vs the current Android 12. It lacks a few features that the 12, but it costs twice as much, is heavier, thicker, and longer, has a better quality screen, and 4 GB ram and 64 GB ROM vs the 12 with 2 GB ram and 32 GB ROM. With each new model, you have to go through a setup process, : language, Wi-Fi connection, etc. This one would not go past the Wi-Fi, even though connecting, it just keeps authenticating and save in a loop. So I have to advise support again. Admittedly, electronics and I do not make good bedfellows.I reiterate, I think Umidigi phones are great technologically, and I want to have a working one. I am slowly working my way through and finding interesting and amazing built-in applications within and easy to set up. They have a complete one-year warranty.Despite the problems listed above, I would recommend their products.As of this date (1/9/2023), I am giving a rating of 5-stars. After spending some time using the Google Assistant, I was able to set up many options. I know that there are more things that this phone can do, and will dig them out. I currently have 40 apps (Google and some others come already installed (and cannot be removed) and Google Play Store is protected). I set up a powerful cleaner that has 7 functions, and an antivirus, phone locator, etc., plus others of interest. I have since learned that Android phones can heat up to 65* C without damage to the CPU, etc. This one runs from 26 to 45*C. The cameras are quite good, but do not always capture the true colours, but there are various options to edit photos. I have used the music option and the sound is balanced stereo. At first, I thought the Assistant was deaf, but the issue is that this phone has only 1.5 Ghz speed, so it needs a few minutes to load apps and run smoothly. You will hear chimes as each of the main apps load at the top of the main menu screen. I use it several times a day, from 3 to 5 hours, with no problems. Battery life is good. I only charge every 4 or days or so, and only to 85% to extend battery life. The clear thick plastic bottom cover is a good safety feature. I did find a small chip at the top of the screen, previously unnoticed in the black rim around the outside of the screen. I have dropped it a few times.As well, there are system updates periodically to install. It is important to familiarize yourself with the settings app (a lot of hidden information treasures there).The pop out sim and TF/SD tray is triggered by a tiny tool which may be hidden anywhere in the product box.Support is available 24/7.Initially, I bought this phone primarily for emergency situations. But due to Covid, I have not signed with a carrier as yet. The good thing abut these phones is that they come unlocked and can theoretically be signed with any carrier in Canada (apparently not so much in the USA).After a frustrating period getting to know this phone, I would highly recommend it. For an inexpensive price, you are getting a gem to work with.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the Netherlands on April 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Ik heb de telefoon nu een aantal weken in gebruik en erger mij groen en geel aan de traagheid van het apparaat.Dit verwacht je niet van een nieuw toestel.Geen aanrader!

La verdad es que me ha sorprendido este móvil por el precio que tiene. El material es plástico pero tiene un acabado metalizado que hace que parezca metal. La pantalla se ve bastante bien y es grande, no tiene mucho notch. El peso me sorprendió porque pesa poco aunque tenga 5150mAh de batería. Viene con una funda transparente de silicona y tiene puesto un protector de pantalla. Tiene radio FM y entrada de auriculares que casi ningún móvil tiene.De los 32GB viene ocupado 5,5GB, que está bien porque viene bastante limpio de aplicaciones preinstaladas, trae las de google y poco más.La cámara es de 13MP y adjunto fotos para que se vea la calidad.Se carga con un cable usb tipo C. Tiene para dos tarjetas sim o para una sim y una de memoria. Las pegas que le he encontrado es que le falta un poco más de fluidez, cuando se abre una aplicación tarda un poco en cargar pero luego va bien. Tampoco tiene lector de huellas pero normal por este precio.Yo lo recomendaría para alguien que no tenga móvil y necesite uno a buen precio o como segundo móvil para trabajar.

The media could not be loaded. Il cellulare si presenta piacevole al tatto e responsivo per quello che è l'hardware con cui è carrozzato (2 GB di RAM e processore Cortex A53) grazie all'impiego di Android 12 GO (la versione più leggera di Android dedicata a dispositivi con hardware dedicato).Per 99 Euro (il prezzo attuale al momento della recensione) è un telefono onesto che fa quello che deve.WhatsApp, Messenger, Teelegram, Facebook, YouTube e gli altri social funzionano bene e sono responsivi. Poco usabile TikTok perché risulta troppo pesante da gestire.Utilizzabile con tutte le app Google ed il PlayStore è presente senza alcuna limitazione.Lo schermo è responsivo al tocco e non ha problemi di fluidità.Non è presente il riconoscimento delle impronte digitali né il riconoscimento facciale, scelta positiva perché in hardware limitati creano solo appesantimento inutile.Come applicativi di utilità ho provato anche lo SPID di Poste Italiane (PosteID) e le applicazioni bancarie e non hanno avuto alcun problema.Buono il reparto audio (dal video allegato alla recensione si sente che ha una buona potenza).Meno performante per i videogiochi recenti ma questo non è uno smartphone creato per il gioco.In generale un buon prodotto che merita 5 stelle per il rapporto qualità/prezzo, ottimo come smartphone entry level da dare ai propri figli come primo dispositivo ed ottimo come secondo telefono da affiancare al dispositivo principale (io lo uso come telefono per le comunicazioni personali quando spengo il telefono dedicato al business).

Ho letto tante recensioni positive decisi di comprarlo come telefono di riserva ma credo che non ci voglia uno scienziato per vedere quanto sia inutilizzabile questo telefono, molto bello esteticamente a mio avviso ma finisce qui.Lento, va a scatti INUTILIZZABILE non compratelo!!!!!Fatto reso!
